en.text: What a person's mind can comprehend and what he can believe, he is able to achieve
en.author: Napoleon Hill, journalist and writer

en.text: Strive not for success, but for the values it gives
en.author: Albert Einstein

en.text: I owe my success to the fact that I have never made excuses or accepted excuses from others
en.author: Florence Nightingale

en.text: During my career, I missed more than 9,000 shots, lost almost 300 games
en.author: Michael Jordan

en.text: The hardest thing is to start acting, everything else depends only on perseverance
en.author: Amelia Earhart

en.text: One must love life more than the meaning of life
en.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

en.text: Life is what happens to you while you're making plans
en.author: John Lennon

en.text: Logic can lead you from point A to point B, and imagination - anywhere
en.author: Albert Einstein

en.text: In 20 years you will be more disappointed with the things you didn't do than the ones you did
en.author: Mark Twain

en.text: It's always worth starting with something that sows doubts
en.author: Boris Strugatsky

en.text: Real responsibility is only personal
en.author: Fazil Iskander

en.text: An unintelligent life is not worth living
en.author: Socrates

en.text: 80% of success is to appear in the right place at the right time
en.author: Woody Allen

en.text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life
en.author: Steve Jobs

en.text: Victory is not everything, everything is a constant desire to win
en.author: Vince Lombardi, American football coach

en.text: Science is organized knowledge, wisdom is organized life
en.author: Immanuel Kant

en.text: There is no word 'impossible' in my dictionary
en.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

en.text: You will never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore
en.author: Christopher Columbus

en.text: Freedom is worthless if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes
en.author: Mahatma Gandhi

en.text: Either you control your day, or the day controls you
en.author: Jim Ron, speaker and business coach

en.text: If you think you're capable of something, you're right; if you think you won't succeed, you're right too
en.author: Henry Ford

en.text: The two most important days in your life: the day you were born and the day you realized why
en.author: Mark Twain

en.text: Start doing everything you can do – and even what you can at least dream of
en.author: Johann Wolfgang Goethe

en.text: The best revenge is a huge success
en.author: Frank Sinatra

en.text: It is often said that motivation does not last long
en.author: Zig Ziglar, writer, businessman and marketing consultant

en.text: Weak people try to be no worse than others all their lives
en.author: Boris Akunin

en.text: It's all about thoughts
en.author: Leo Tolstoy

en.text: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing and be nobody
en.author: Aristotle

en.text: The person you are destined to become is only the person you decide to become
en.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, essayist, poet and philosopher

en.text: Walk confidently towards the dream
en.author: Henry David Thoreau, writer, thinker, naturalist

en.text: I hope that at the end of my days, when I stand before God, I will not have a drop of talent left so that I can say to him I used everything that you gave me
en.author: Erma Bombek, writer, journalist

en.text: It's better to be sure of a good result than to hope for an excellent one
en.author: Warren Buffett

en.text: Some things can capture your attention, but focus better on those that capture your heart
en.author: Indian proverb

en.text: One has only to believe that you can – and you are already halfway to the goal
en.author: Theodore Roosevelt

en.text: Don't blame a child for being afraid of the dark
en.author: Plato

en.text: Learn to speak “I do not know”, and this will already be progress
en.author: Moses Maimonides, Jewish philosopher and theologian

en.text: Start from where you are now
en.author: Arthur Ashe, tennis player

en.text: When I was 5 years old, my mother always said that the main thing in life is happiness
en.author: John Lennon

en.text: Fall seven times and rise eight times
en.author: Japanese saying

en.text: When one door closes fortunately, another opens immediately
en.author: Helen Keller, writer, lecturer, political activist

en.text: Everything has its own beauty, but not everyone can see it
en.author: Confucius

en.text: How wonderful that you don't have to wait a minute to start making the world a better place
en.author: Anne Frank

en.text: When I get rid of who I am, I become who I can be
en.author: Lao Tzu

en.text: Happiness is not something ready-made
en.author: Dalai Lama

en.text: If you are offered a place in a rocket carrier, do not ask what kind of place! Just take it
en.author: Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook COO

en.text: First decide on your ideal: set a goal
en.author: Aristotle

en.text: If there is no wind, take the oars
en.author: Latin proverb

en.text: Always rely on the idea that your own decision to succeed is much more important than anything else
en.author: Abraham Lincoln

en.text: Success is the ability to go from defeat to defeat without losing optimism
en.author: Winston Churchill

en.text: They ask: 'How can you manage all the cases in fifteen minutes?' I answer: 'It's simple'
en.author: Richard Branson, British entrepreneur, founder of Virgin Corporation

en.text: Everyone wants to change humanity, but no one thinks about how to change themselves
en.author: Leo Tolstoy

en.text: It is important to believe that talent is given to us for a reason – and that at any cost it must be used for something
en.author: Marie Curie

en.text: If an inner voice tells you that you can't draw - draw as much as possible, then this voice will subside
en.author: Vincent Van Gogh

en.text: Goal certainty is the starting point of all achievements
en.author: William Clement Stone, writer and businessman

en.text: We become what we think about
en.author: Earl Nightingale, radio host

en.text: I am not a victim of circumstances, I am the result of my decisions
en.author: Stephen Covey, consultant and lecturer in organizational management

en.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago
en.author: Chinese proverb

en.text: All children are artists
en.author: Pablo Picasso

en.text: I was struck by how important it is to take action
en.author: Leonardo da Vinci

en.text: What is money? A person is successful if he wakes up in the morning, returns to bed in the evening, and does what he likes during the break
en.author: Bob Dylan

en.text: I didn't fail the test
en.author: Benjamin Franklin

en.text: Defeat is not defeat unless you recognize it as such in your mind
en.author: Bruce Lee

en.text: Failure is just an opportunity to start again, but more wisely
en.author: Henry Ford

en.text: I'm sure: you can't let the wretched word 'you can't' stop you
en.author: Richard Branson

en.text: Only the one who doesn't try anything new never makes mistakes
en.author: Albert Einstein

en.text: You become what you believe in
en.author: Oprah Winfrey, TV presenter

en.text: Happiness is not in always doing what you want, but in always wanting what you do
en.author: Leo Tolstoy

en.text: I'd rather die of passion than of boredom
en.author: Vincent van Gogh

en.text: You learn the fastest in three cases - before the age of 7, at trainings, and when life has driven you into a corner
en.author: Stephen Covey

en.text: People will forget what you said will forget what you did, but will never forget what you made them feel
en.author: Maya Angelou, writer and poet

en.text: Our consciousness is everything
en.author: Buddha

en.text: If you want to build a ship, you don't need to call people, plan, share work, get tools
en.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

en.text: Never think that you already know everything
en.author: Ivan Pavlov, a scientist-physiologist

en.text: It's not as important how slowly you walk as how long you walk without stopping
en.author: Confucius

en.text: If you think about what you have in life, you can always have more
en.author: Oprah Winfrey

en.text: Turn your large-scale thoughts into large-scale actions as quickly as possible
en.author: Donald Trump

en.text: To lead people, follow them
en.author: Lao Tzu

en.text: Remember that not achieving success is sometimes also a great success
en.author: Dalai Lama

en.text: Always choose the most difficult path - you will not meet competitors on it
en.author: Charles de Gaulle

en.text: One completed productive task is worth fifty half-completed tasks
en.author: Malcolm Forbes

en.text: Our life begins to come to an end when we stop talking about really important things
en.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

en.text: Trouble does not come alone, but luck too
en.author: Romain Rolland, writer

en.text: Every thought is like a test, it's worth mashing it well — you can make everything out of it
en.author: Ivan Turgenev

en.text: Do everything you can, wherever you are, using everything you have
en.author: Theodore Roosevelt

en.text: Remember, no one can make you feel inferior without your consent
en.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

en.text: The world is divided into two classes - some believe in the incredible, others do the impossible
en.author: Oscar Wilde

en.text: The only happiness in life is a constant striving forward
en.author: Emile Zola

en.text: Not the strongest survives, but the most susceptible to change
en.author: Charles Darwin

en.text: You can say that you have bad genetics, bad metabolism, and you can just raise your ass off the couch and start working on yourself, set a goal and believe in yourself
en.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

en.text: Never falling is not the greatest merit in life
en.author: Nelson Mandela

en.text: The question is not who will allow me, but who will be able to forbid me
en.author: Ayn Rand

en.text: When it seems that the whole world is against you, remember that the plane takes off not in the wind, but against it
en.author: Henry Ford

en.text: Life is measured not by how many years there are in it, but by how many years of real life there are in these years
en.author: Abraham Lincoln

en.text: To benefit the world is the only way to become happy
en.author: Hans Christian Andersen

en.text: Either write something worthwhile or do something worth writing about
en.author: Benjamin Franklin

en.text: The only way to do something very well is to love what you do
en.author: Steve Jobs

en.text: A wise man demands everything only from himself, an insignificant man demands everything from others
en.author: Leo Tolstoy

en.text: Great are those who see that thoughts rule the world
en.author: Ralph Emerson

en.text: Before climbing the ladder of success, make sure that it is leaning against the wall of the building that you need
en.author: Stephen Covey

en.text: At the origins of every successful enterprise is a bold decision once made
en.author: Peter Drucker, American economist
